definition: homeless
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
surname Gui

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: We were bombed out during the Anti-Japanese War.
sentences.chinese: 抗战期间我们被炸得无家可归。

sentences.english: Not too many for the millions of homeless.
sentences.chinese: 没有太多的给那些数百万无家可归的人。

sentences.english: I found myself homeless and alone.
sentences.chinese: 我发先自己无依无靠，无家可归。

sentences.english: Many homeless people were living here.
sentences.chinese: 很多无家可归的人住在这里。

sentences.english: Many of the displaced are sheltering in schools.
sentences.chinese: 许多无家可归的人现在在学校暂时栖身。

sentences.english: The typhoon, referred to locally as Milenyo, caused floods and landslides that have displaced some 5,500 people.
sentences.chinese: 台风造成的水灾和塌方使大约5500人无家可归。

sentences.english: I can't leave because if I leave I'd be homeless.
sentences.chinese: 我不能离开，如果我离开就无家可归了。

sentences.english: Ignoring a homeless person who asks for money.
sentences.chinese: 街上一个无家可归的人向你要钱，你扬长而去。

sentences.english: I couldnt help it but cry and cried as I became homeless.
sentences.chinese: 我不能帮助它而哭，哭了，当我变得无家可归。

sentences.english: Benedict recalled the plight of "street children who do not have the blessing of a family home."
sentences.chinese: 教皇提醒信徒不要忘记那些无家可归的流浪儿的处境。

sentences.english: Send these, the homeless, tempest-tossed to me.
sentences.chinese: 送过来吧这些无家可归的，四处漂泊的的人。

sentences.english: Since his parents died of illness, he has been homeless.
sentences.chinese: 自从他的父母病故以来，他就一直无家可归。

sentences.english: When people left homeless when a night shelter to promote social harmony.
sentences.chinese: 当别人无家可归的时候，一晚借宿能促进社会的和谐。

sentences.english: The homeless child dematerialized into the night.
sentences.chinese: 那个无家可归的孩子消失在夜幕之中。

sentences.english: The floods left many people destitute.
sentences.chinese: 洪水让许多人缺衣少食，无家可归。

sentences.english: My love of to dight finds no home in the nest deserted by yesterday's love.
sentences.chinese: 于昨日之爱抛弃的巢穴中，我的本日之爱无家可归。

definition: destitute and homeless (idiom); forced from one's home and wandering about/displaced
to offer shelter/to have sb in one's care
no one to rely on (idiom); on one's own/orphaned/left to one's own devices
to wander far from home
beset by hunger and cold (idiom)/starving and freezing/in desperate poverty
temporary shelter/hospice/refuge (e.g. for animals)/detention center
solitary and impoverished (idiom)
to drift about/to wander/to roam/nomadic/homeless/unsettled (e.g. population)/vagrant
to be without a fixed residence (idiom)
shelter/refuge
orphan
to provide a place to stay/to house/to accommodate/(of an institution etc) to take in/to accept
street urchin/waif
penniless (idiom)
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
to run away from trouble/to flee from calamity/to be a refugee
